1.title: Title XY
1.plot: Mesh horns in on Libby's interview with a volunteer for a flush women-only endowment which is being protested for discrimination against men.

2.title: Dream Job
2.plot: In which Mesh butts in on a fellow reporter's interview and talks to some protesters.

3.title: Lapdog
3.plot: Mesh gets an earful from his editor, Jason, regarding unverified source quotes, but suspects a different reason for the verbal shakedown.

4.title: Clickbait Garbage
4.plot: Mesh and campus gossip blog helmer Suze Chou have a heart to heart; Mesh gets criticized (again) for cribbing Libby's story, and Mesh faces down Con Man.

5.title: The Dreaded Red Ass
5.plot: Mesh warns Libby there's more to her story, but she tells him to back off. Mesh remembers something vital about his Ethics class, but a visit to his professor ends enigmatically.

6.title: Salty Tang
6.plot: Mesh is convinced Jason is compromised but Grant isn't so sure.

imdb.plot outline: Mesh Kilbourne is a tenacious, ambitious student journalist whose quest for the truth outweighs social niceties, friendships, and protocol. When he stumbles on a possible cheating scandal involving his editor in chief, he begins sniffing out the truth. But when the story leads him to investigate the president of the school, he may have uncovered more than he bargained for and made a powerful enemy in the process. Will truth win out over intrigue? Will Mesh learn how to make friends while alienating people? Has he got the scoop of a lifetime? Or will the whole story blow up in his face?
imdb.title: Copy
plot: A student journalist at a small Christian college tracks a story of corruption and financial scandal that threatens to take down his editor and the school president.::Lewis, Jeremiah
